header.gameNote: CHICAGO INVITATIONAL CHALLENGE AT HOFFMAN ESTATES IL

article.headline: Miami(Ohio) 57, Rutgers 44
article.story: HOFFMAN ESTATES, Ill. (AP) -- Tim Pollitz scored 13 points and Alex Moosmann added 12 points as Miami (Ohio) defeated Rutgers 57-44 on Saturday night in the Chicago Invitational Challenge. Leading 36-33 late in the second half, Miami (3-3) pulled away by going on a 10-2 run. Doug Penno and Nathan Peavy hit back-to-back 3's for the RedHawks and Pollitz had a breakaway layup making it 44-35 with 4:00 left in the game. Peavy added 11 points and nine rebounds for Miami. Michael Bramos finished a back-door pass with a dunk to extend the RedHawks lead to 46-36. He ended the game with six points. J.R. Inman finished with 11 points and nine rebounds for the Scarlet Knights, who shot 27 percent in the game. The RedHawks led 18-17 at the half. Both teams struggled offensively in the half. Rutgers (1-4) shot 27 percent and Miami was held to 22 percent shooting, but shot 58 percent in the second half.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
